128 Arterburn ^ Weak perfect compactness and generalized adjoints
6.  5 Lemma.  Let X and Z be B-spaces.  Let S he the closed unit sphere of [ X,  Z ]. Then S is compact in the weak operator topology iff Z is reflexioe. 
We are now able to prove the following interesting analogue of full compactness. 
6.  6 Theorem.  Let X,  F,  and Z be B-spaces with Z reflexive.  Let S be the closed unit sphere of [ F,  Z ]. Then a map A : X- > F is compact iff ^ + is TZ '- compact. 
Proof,  Apply 4.  1 to obtain the continuity of A + | tS : ( aS,  T FZ ') ( X +, TZ '). By
6.  5,  ( iS,  T FZ ') is compact,  whence ( A + ( 5 ), TZ ') is compact. 
Bibliography
[ 1 ] Dunfordf Nelson,  and T,  Jacob Schwartz,  Linear Operators Part I,  New York and London 1958. 
[ 2 ] Goldberg,  Seymour,  and A,  H,  Kruse,  The Existence of Compact Linear Maps between Banach Spaces,  Pro ceedings American Mathematical Society 13 ( 1962 ), 808—811. 
[ 3 ] S,  Goldberg and E,  Thorp,  The Range as Range Space for Compact Operators,  This Journal 211 ( 1962 ), 113—115. 
[ 4 ] B.  C,  James,  Weakly Compact Sets.  Notices Amer.  Math.  Soc. , Abstract 63T—208,  ( June 1963 ), 368. 
[ 5 ] Edward 0,  Thorp,  The Range as Range Space for Compact Operators.  II ( to appear in this Journal ).
Eingegangen 11.  Mai 1964
